revision.text:
{{Infobox Historic site |name=Invercauld Castle |location=Near [[Braemar]], [[Aberdeenshire]], [[Scotland]] |image=Invercauld House - geograph.org.uk - 423852.jpg |caption=Invercauld Castle |locmapin= Scotland Aberdeenshire |map_caption = Location of Invercauld Castle in Aberdeenshire |latitude= 57.0155 |longitude= -3.3618 |map_size= |built= 16th century, remodelled 1875 |built_for= [[Clan Farquharson]] |architect= John Thomas Wimperis (1875) | designation1 = Category a listed building | designation1_offname = Invercauld House | designation1_date = 24 November 1972 | designation1_number = 2995 | designation2 = inventory of gardens and designed landscapes | designation2_criteria = Historical
Scenic | designation2_date = 1987 }} '''Invercauld Castle'''{{Pronunciation-needed}} is a country house situated in [[Royal Deeside]] near [[Braemar]] in [[Scotland]]. It is protected as a category A [[listed building]],{{cite web |url=http://hsewsf.sedsh.gov.uk/hslive/hsstart?P_HBNUM=2995 |title=Invercauld House: Listed Building Report |publisher=Historic Scotland}} and the grounds are included in the [[Inventory of Gardens and Designed Landscapes in Scotland]].{{cite web |url=http://data.historic-scotland.gov.uk/pls/htmldb/f?p=2400:15:0::::GARDEN:GDL00224 |title=Invercauld |work=An Inventory of Gardens and Designed Landscapes in Scotland |publisher=Historic Scotland}} ==History== The [[Clan Farquharson|Farquharson family]] settled in the area in the 14th century, and constructed a [[tower houses in Britain and Ireland|tower house]] in the 16th century. A vaulted basement within the present building dates from this time, although the tower house was remodelled in the late 17th century. Further alterations were made through the 18th and 19th centuries, and in 1875 the castle was extensively remodelled by John Thomas Wimperis in the [[Scots Baronial]] style. The house retains many Victorian furnishing and paintings. [[File:Invercauld House - Circa 1850.jpg|left|200|thumb|The castle in the early 1800s prior to extensive alterations]] ==The estate== The castle estate comprises approximately {{convert|200|sqmi|km2|sigfig=2}}, set within the [[Cairngorm National Park]], including a length of the [[River Dee, Aberdeenshire|River Dee]]. The tenth laird, James Farquharson, planted significant portions of the estate to woodland to supply the shipyards of nearby [[Aberdeen]]. Invercauld's sporting estate and location near the royal highland home of [[Balmoral Castle]] made it a favourite resort of [[Queen Victoria]]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.invercauld.org/ Invercauld Estate] [[Category:Castles in Aberdeenshire]] [[Category:Category A listed buildings in Aberdeenshire]] [[Category:Inventory of Gardens and Designed Landscapes]] {{Scotland-castle-stub}}
